# Set {.unnumbered}

**Instance of**: mathematical model

**AKA**: empty set;  singleton; infinite set

**Distinct from**: list

**English**: A set is a collection of elements with no ordering, e.g. $\{1,2,3\}=\{3,2,1\}$.

**Formalization**:

Roster notation
$$
A=\{4,2,1,3\}
$$
Abbreviation with ellipsis
$$
A=\{1,2,3,...,1000\}
$$
Infinite sets beginning and or ending in ellipsis
$$
A=\{1,2,3,...\}
$$

$$
A=\{...,-3,-2,-1,0,1,2,3,...\}
$$

Semantic definition uses a natural language rule to determine which elements belong in a set

> Let A be the set whose members are the first four positive integers.

> Let B be the set of colors of the French flag.

[Set-builder notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Set-builder_notation)
